title: Video - Usage Examples
description: Embed YouTube, Vimeo, or self-hosted videos with custom thumbnails, play icons, and animations

examples.name: Simple YouTube Video Embed
examples.visualDescription: YouTube video player with standard controls, no related videos at end, privacy-enhanced mode
examples.useCase: Product demos, tutorials, promotional videos, how-to guides
notes: VideoType='youtube' for YouTube videos
YoutubeID is the video ID from YouTube URL (not full URL)
controls=true shows play/pause, volume, fullscreen controls
rel=false hides related videos at end (better UX)
yt_privacy=true uses youtube-nocookie.com (privacy-enhanced mode)
iframeTitle improves accessibility (screen reader announcement)

examples.name: YouTube Video with Custom Thumbnail
examples.description: YouTube video with custom banner image and play icon
examples.visualDescription: Custom thumbnail image covers video until clicked, centered play icon overlay, smooth fade-in when video starts
examples.useCase: Marketing videos, testimonials, case studies, product showcases
notes: ShowBannerImg=true enables custom thumbnail (hides default YouTube thumbnail)
BannerImg.url is the custom thumbnail image URL
BannerImgSize='full' uses full WordPress image size
VideoTitle appears as caption overlay on thumbnail
TitleColor + TitleBgColor style the caption (white text on semi-transparent black)
IconAlign='center' centers the play icon (options: center, left, right)
autoPlay=false requires user click to play (better UX, accessibility)
Thumbnail disappears when video starts playing

examples.name: Vimeo Video with Player Color
examples.description: Vimeo video with custom player color and metadata
examples.visualDescription: Vimeo player with purple controls/progress bar, video title, author byline, author portrait visible
examples.useCase: Company culture videos, creative portfolios, professional video content
notes: VideoType='vimeo' for Vimeo videos
VimeoID is the video ID from Vimeo URL (e.g., vimeo.com/123456789)
VideoColor sets Vimeo player controls color (hex code)
VimeoTitle=true shows video title inside player
VimeoByline=true shows video author name
VimeoPortrait=true shows author's profile picture
Vimeo player has cleaner, more professional look than YouTube
Set all three to false for minimal player (just video + controls)

examples.name: Self-Hosted Video with Fallback
examples.description: MP4 video hosted on your server with fallback image
examples.visualDescription: Custom video player with your MP4 file, browser-native controls, fallback image if video fails to load
examples.useCase: Private videos, training materials, internal communications, videos without YouTube/Vimeo accounts
notes: VideoType='self-hosted' for MP4 files on your server
mp4Url.url is the direct URL to .mp4 file
fallbackImage shows if video fails to load (acts as poster frame)
Self-hosted videos give you full control (no third-party branding)
Ensure video is optimized for web (H.264 codec, compressed)
Consider CDN for better performance (large MP4 files)
Browser-native controls style varies by browser
VideoBRadius adds rounded corners to video player

examples.name: Video with Animated Play Icon
examples.description: YouTube video with pulsing play icon animation
examples.visualDescription: Custom thumbnail with centered play icon that pulses continuously, drawing attention to video, purple gradient background on icon
examples.useCase: Hero sections, landing pages, attention-grabbing videos, call-to-action videos
notes: ContinueAnim=true enables icon animation
ContinueAnimEffect='pulse' creates pulsing effect (options: pulse, rotating, drop_waves)
ContinueAnimHover=false animates continuously (true = only on hover)
ContinueAnimDur='2' sets animation duration (2 seconds per cycle)
PlayIconSize='120' sets icon size to 120px (default: 100px)
IconRadius with 50% creates circular play icon
Pulse animation is subtle, professional (rotating is more aggressive)
drop_waves creates ripple effect (dramatic, attention-grabbing)

examples.name: Video Popup (Lightbox Mode)
examples.description: Video opens in lightbox/modal overlay when clicked
examples.visualDescription: Small video thumbnail with play icon, clicking opens full-screen video lightbox overlay with close button
examples.useCase: Video galleries, portfolio showcases, testimonial collections, space-saving video embeds
notes: VideoPopup=true opens video in lightbox overlay (instead of inline)
Thumbnail stays small, video opens full-screen when clicked
autoPlay=true auto-plays when lightbox opens (user initiated action)
Great for saving space on page (multiple videos without long page)
User can close lightbox to return to page
Works with YouTube, Vimeo, and self-hosted videos
Ensure BannerImg aspect ratio matches video (16:9 recommended)
Lightbox has dark overlay behind video (focuses attention)

examples.name: Video with Schema Markup (SEO)
examples.description: YouTube video with structured data for search engines
examples.visualDescription: Standard YouTube embed with invisible schema markup for Google search results, video may appear in video search with thumbnail and metadata

attributes.VideoTitle: How to Use Our Product - Complete Tutorial
attributes.VideoDesc: Learn how to set up and use our product in this comprehensive tutorial. Covers installation, configuration, and advanced features.

examples.useCase: Tutorial videos, product demonstrations, educational content, videos targeting search traffic
notes: markupSch=true adds VideoObject schema markup (SEO benefit)
VideoTitle is used in schema as video name (be descriptive, keyword-rich)
VideoDesc is used in schema as description (150-200 characters, explain video content)
BannerImg is used as schema thumbnail (helps video appear in Google search)
Schema markup helps video appear in Google Video Search results
Can improve click-through rates from search engines
Ensure VideoTitle and VideoDesc accurately describe video content
Schema data is invisible to users, only read by search engines

examples.name: Styled Video with Border and Shadow
examples.description: Video player with custom styling (border, shadow, hover effects)
examples.visualDescription: YouTube video with purple border, subtle shadow, rounded corners; on hover, shadow deepens and slight scale transform
examples.useCase: Featured videos, premium content, styled landing pages, design-focused websites
notes: VideoBorder adds border to video player (normal state)
VideoBRadius rounds corners (12px creates subtle rounding)
BoxShadow adds drop shadow (purple glow effect at 30% opacity)
VideoBorderH changes border color on hover (purple to darker purple gradient)
BoxShadowH deepens shadow on hover (larger blur, more spread)
TransformH='scale(1.02)' slightly enlarges video on hover (subtle lift effect)
Hover effects create interactive, premium feel
Ensure border/shadow colors match site design
Don't overdo transform (scale > 1.05 is jarring)
Rounded corners may clip video controls slightly (test in browser)

videoTypeGuide.youtube: YouTube videos (most common, best performance, auto-generated thumbnails)
videoTypeGuide.vimeo: Vimeo videos (professional, cleaner player, customizable player color)
videoTypeGuide.self-hosted: MP4 files on your server (full control, no third-party branding, larger file sizes)

playIconOptions.default: No VideoIcon set (uses default circular play icon)
playIconOptions.custom: VideoIcon.url set (upload custom play icon image, e.g., branded icon)

animationEffects.drop_waves: Ripple effect emanates from icon (dramatic, modern)

youtubeOptions.rel: Show related videos at end (false = hide, better UX)
youtubeOptions.showinfo: Show video title and uploader before playing (deprecated by YouTube)
youtubeOptions.ModestBranding: Remove YouTube logo from control bar (partial, YouTube still shows logo)

vimeoOptions.VimeoTitle: Show video title in player (default: true)

autoPlayBehavior.inline: autoPlay=true plays video on page load (bad UX, avoid unless muted)
autoPlayBehavior.popup: autoPlay=true in VideoPopup mode is OK (user-initiated click)
autoPlayBehavior.accessibility: Avoid autoPlay unless muted (screen reader users, bandwidth concerns)

validationRules.YoutubeID: Required when VideoType='youtube', must be valid YouTube video ID
validationRules.VimeoID: Required when VideoType='vimeo', must be valid Vimeo video ID
validationRules.mp4Url: Required when VideoType='self-hosted', must be valid .mp4 URL
validationRules.BannerImg.url: Required when ShowBannerImg=true, must be valid image URL
validationRules.VideoTitle: Optional, string (appears on banner if ShowBannerImg=true)
validationRules.VideoDesc: Optional, string (used in schema markup if markupSch=true)
validationRules.iframeTitle: Recommended for accessibility, string describing video content
validationRules.ContinueAnimEffect: Required if ContinueAnim=true, must be 'pulse', 'rotating', or 'drop_waves'

warnings: CRITICAL: autoPlay=true without muted=true is bad UX (unexpected sound, accessibility issues)
CRITICAL: Use correct VideoType for video platform (youtube vs vimeo vs self-hosted)
Don't use YouTube video ID for VimeoID or vice versa (video won't load)
ShowBannerImg=true requires BannerImg.url (video won't show without thumbnail)
Custom thumbnails should match video aspect ratio (16:9 recommended)
yt_privacy=true may break some YouTube features (analytics, annotations)
rel=false may not work on all YouTube embeds (YouTube controls this)
Self-hosted videos should be optimized for web (H.264, compressed, < 50MB)
VideoPopup=true may conflict with page popups/modals (test thoroughly)
ContinueAnim=true can be distracting (use sparingly, test with users)
drop_waves animation is resource-intensive (avoid on mobile-heavy sites)
Schema markup (markupSch=true) requires VideoTitle and VideoDesc (improves SEO)
iframeTitle should be descriptive for screen readers (e.g., 'Product demo video')
Large PlayIconSize (> 150px) may look awkward on small thumbnails
Border radius may clip video controls slightly (test in browser)
Transform effects (scale, rotate) may cause layout shifts (test on different screen sizes)
commonMistakes: Using full YouTube URL instead of just video ID (use 'dQw4w9WgXcQ', not 'https://youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ')
Setting autoPlay=true without muted=true (unexpected sound annoys users)
Enabling ShowBannerImg but not providing BannerImg.url (video won't display)
Using low-quality custom thumbnails (blurry, wrong aspect ratio)
Setting VideoPopup=true and autoPlay=true (video starts playing before lightbox opens)
Using VideoType='youtube' with VimeoID set (video won't load)
Setting ContinueAnimEffect without ContinueAnim=true (animation doesn't run)
Using very long VideoTitle that overflows banner (keep to 8-10 words max)
Using self-hosted videos > 100MB (slow page load, poor mobile performance)
Not testing video on mobile (controls may be too small, autoPlay blocked)
Setting rel=true (shows unrelated videos at end, drives users away from site)
Using rotating animation continuously (distracting, makes users dizzy)
Forgetting to set yt_privacy=true (GDPR compliance issue for EU visitors)
bestPractices: Always set iframeTitle for accessibility (describe video content)
Use yt_privacy=true for GDPR compliance (YouTube privacy-enhanced mode)
Set rel=false to hide related videos (keep users on your site)
Avoid autoPlay unless video is muted (better UX, accessibility)
Use custom thumbnails (ShowBannerImg=true) for branding, better CTR
Optimize custom thumbnails (WebP format, 1280x720px, < 200KB)
Keep VideoTitle concise (8-10 words max) to prevent overflow
Use markupSch=true for tutorial/educational videos (SEO benefit)
Write detailed VideoDesc when using schema (150-200 characters)
For hero videos, use ContinueAnimEffect='pulse' (subtle, professional)
For attention-grabbing videos, use drop_waves (dramatic, modern)
Test videos on mobile devices (controls, thumbnail size, autoPlay behavior)
Use VideoPopup=true for video galleries (saves space, better UX)
For self-hosted videos, use CDN and optimize (H.264, < 50MB)
Set controls=true (users expect standard video controls)
Use 16:9 aspect ratio thumbnails (standard for videos)
For Vimeo, set VideoColor to match brand (consistent design)
Hide Vimeo metadata (VimeoTitle/Byline/Portrait=false) for minimal player
Use loop=true for background videos (subtle, continuous)
Add subtle border/shadow for visual separation from content
Test hover effects on touch devices (may not work as expected)
accessibilityNotes: CRITICAL: Always set iframeTitle (screen readers announce this)
CRITICAL: Don't autoPlay videos with sound (distracts screen reader users)
Ensure video has captions/subtitles (not controlled by this block, add in YouTube/Vimeo)
Provide text alternative or transcript near video (for deaf users)
Ensure play icon has sufficient contrast (minimum 3:1 ratio)
Test keyboard navigation (Space/Enter should play video)
Ensure video controls are keyboard accessible (browser-native controls are)
Don't rely solely on video to convey information (provide text summary)
For decorative videos (background), use empty iframeTitle or aria-hidden
Ensure focus indicator is visible on play icon (test with Tab key)
Avoid flashing content in videos (can trigger seizures)
Test with screen reader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) to verify announcements
Provide audio description track for visual-only content (if applicable)
performanceConsiderations: Self-hosted videos should be < 50MB (larger files slow page load)
Use custom thumbnails to defer video loading (ShowBannerImg=true)
Optimize custom thumbnails (WebP format, compressed, responsive sizes)
Avoid autoPlay (videos load on page load, increases bandwidth)
Use VideoPopup=true to lazy-load videos (only load when clicked)
For self-hosted videos, use CDN (faster delivery, lower server load)
Compress MP4 files (H.264 codec, CRF 23, 1080p max for web)
Test on mobile networks (slow 3G/4G, videos may timeout)
Limit videos per page (3-5 max, more impacts performance)
Use drop_waves animation sparingly (CSS-intensive, impacts mobile)
Avoid large PlayIconSize on mobile (scales down, wastes resources)
Test cumulative layout shift (CLS) with videos (ensure stable aspect ratio)
Consider poster frame (fallbackImage) for self-hosted videos (faster perceived load)
seoConsiderations: Enable schema markup (markupSch=true) for tutorial/educational videos
Write keyword-rich VideoTitle (used in schema, search results)
Write detailed VideoDesc (150-200 chars, describes content accurately)
Use high-quality custom thumbnails (influences click-through rate)
Ensure thumbnail is 16:9 aspect ratio, min 1280x720px (schema requirement)
Host videos on YouTube/Vimeo when possible (better indexing than self-hosted)
Add video transcript on page (helps search engines understand content)
Use descriptive iframeTitle (may be used by search engines)
Avoid duplicate video embeds across pages (may dilute search ranking)
Link to video source (YouTube/Vimeo page) for additional context
Use video sitemaps for self-hosted videos (helps Google discover them)
Ensure page title/headings mention video topic (contextual relevance)
